reviews.review_msg: Spends far too much time on his  agenda  rather than helping the class learn.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
very clear on course material but require some thinking on tests
Best prof I've had so far. I was so scared about taking university calc, but with him it's not hard to understand.

I found calculus to be very difficult. His teach method leaves the class only listening, not interacting. It is hard to do in a lecture, but he was so focused on lecturing. He is really excited about math and is a great prof.

Great prof I really enjoyed his class, much better than Dr. Bruin who also teaches 151 or the TAs in answering questions.  I didn't take calculus in high school and it was fine, the prof explains concepts very clearly.  Time management wasn't specifically a problem in this course, do lots of practice exams and they should be ok.

If you didn't take calculus in high school recommend that you do work one week in advance, otherwise you won't understand prof and will waste lots of time lining up for TAs. His notes and pacing are not very organized: was rushing at end of semester. Just filter out the "concepts" garbage and stick to procedures.
Lecture notes are unhelpful, but the midterms are fair. Glad to have already taken calculus in high school.
Now I love math because of this guy!
Good explanation of concepts and gives some good advice for success in the course. Notes are  decent but not always too organized. Exams are fair and usually open book.
Overhead slides, and clear voice when teaching.  Open book tests and the test was hard.  ~~but if you study and know where everything is in the text book you ll do fine.

justin is a nice guy, but a lil shy.good explainations and good notes. teaches @ good pace and easy to understand. exams can be tricky but as long as you study you should be fine. likes to help students too! it will be an honor to be in his later classes.

I really enjoyed this class. Justin gives clear,well-paced lectures. His sense of humor is unusual, but I appreciated it. Students who say he is boring must not be interested in calculus. His priority is teaching, not entertaining students. One downside: you might have to stand up yourself and tell your loud classmates to stop talking in class!

Justin Gray is the Chuck Norris of math. PERIOD. He was pretty straight forward with his teaching, the material was pretty easy for anyone who's done calculus before. I found him to be funny, don't know why, because he's pretty monotone.
willing to help students lol

One of the worst teachers of my life. He's terrible at explaining, and he does not plan out his lectures according to the time given. He seems to try at times to do his best, but still inadequate. He's a serious monotone speaker and coffee or some other caffeinated drink is mandatory for lectures. His exams differ greatly from the material covered.
His teaching was fine, better than Brown.  He prepares you well for exams and assignments but he is by far the hottest prof I have ever had the pleasure to be acquainted with.

Clear, goes at a good pace, organized, hot.   Great math prof.  I wasn't registered for his lecture, but my original prof sucked, so I sat in on his lecture instead and wrote my exams with the sucky prof.  Did pretty well.
No Comments
No Comments
Even though the teaching style is well organized and clear, unexpressiveness tends to monotonize the lectures. Exams and assignments are fair but not easy. Gotta be the hottest prof around.
I was not impressed. I went to my friend's class who had a different teacher and learned everything.
cute
No Comments
Fair tests, monotone :(, but a good/informative teacher
Like a doll, nice to look a but no excitement in his voice whatsoever, even though he knows what he's talking about.
I had him last semester.  He's good looking and smart.
Knows his topic well and has great notes
Boring voice isn't any help in a morning class, but nonetheless a good teacher.
boring but very informative
He barely answers you directly when you ask questions.
a young pro... hope i will learn somthing from him and get good mark
handsome and young prof!
Very clear in his lectures.
Boring voice but conveys info WAY better than other 151 profs (Chen)

I like how he has videos posted on youtube that covers the material which helps a lot if you don't want to go to lectures. The assignments that are for grades also force you to do them, but are very helpful to understand the material and it's hard to slack off in the class
He explains math in a way that makes people understand it better. Although the final exam was long, this class is not curved. The prof and TAs always tried to give you good marks.

Professor Mulholland is very nice and respected and deservedly so but I believe his method of teaching certain concepts makes it a bit difficult for students to understand, make sure you expose yourself to some calculus before taking this class. Also I would highly suggest watching the video lectures on youtube the night before lectures

Explains everything super clearly, reasonable amount of homework and plenty of practice material for exams. Dr. Mullholand was an all-round amazing prof! If you took calculus in high school, just know that calc 1 goes into much more depth and you will still need to put it in lots of effort to do well.

Jamie Mullholand is an amazing professor, and I left his class with no complaints.
Pros:
organized and On Time
-clear grading criteria
-answers any questions , makes sure you understand content
-pretty good explanations
-He explains to make sure you understand the concept/theory

IF U CAN TAKE MATH WITH THIS PROF

From listening to his lectures and talking with Jamie it is very obvious that he cares about what he is teaching. He covers all the material but still takes the time to thoroughly explain all the concepts. I recommend taking a course with Jamie whenever possible.
Only bad thing is that you need to purchase webassign access for around 100$. If you don't get into his class just watch his videos.

Jamie Mulholland is an amazing prof. He explains the material very clearly and does a great job explaining the concepts behind concepts when introducing them, so you know WHY things work the way they do. He also puts up his lectures on YouTube so you can watch them if you miss a day or dont quite get it yet. Course includes weekly in-class quizzes.

Jamie is wonderful, high quality lectures, clear concise notes with many practise examples to prepare you for midterms and the final. Overall he's just very knowledgable and pleasant to listen to, so go to his office hours if you need help, you wont regret it.
Beware of the two mark multiple choice questions though lol

Great professor explains the 'why' behind the math and doesn't just do it, which means that you have to memorize very little and majority of course 'makes sense'. Office hours are also very helpful- puts you on right direction for the questions.
Great teacher, passionate about his teaching, ATEND LECTURES

Amazing professors who explains the topics clearly, has a sense of humor, and is engaging enough so you don't lose focus during lectures. Of course any Math course is going to be difficult so studying outside of lectures is important. Weekly assignments were generally harder or of the same difficulty as the material on the midterms + final.
Best ever math prof, so good at explaining

He is great at explaining things, he gives a good amount of material to study for quizzes/tests, not all of his lectures are mandatory and he has a youtube channel (you can find it by searching his name in youtube) full of tutorial videos for everything in 150 and 151. Pretty much everything you could ask for in a teacher.
amazing teacher

With most the class barely passing or failing he will remind us how dumb and lazy we are but won't listen when given criticism on his teaching habits because he is perfect too smug to be a teacher should find another job

Took MATH 150 this spring with Vijay after failing 151 last semester with Kouzniak. Vijay is a very personable professor and made an otherwise boring class engaging. I enjoyed his stories and the life lessons he shared. He was clear about what would be on the exam and how topics would be tested and marking was lenient. Should finish with B+ or A–.

Very, very, very, very disorganized, there are assignments appear out of thin air that he never mention in class. Gradings are also ambiguous, everything is unsure, he is caring and kind, but that's all good about him, wouldn't take again for sure.

His video lectures are unclear and his handwriting sucks which makes learning from his lectures very hard, I had to result to watching another persons lectures as they were way more helpful. Doesn't email back unless you spam his inbox (which I had to do several times to get a response), his class site is also a mess and hard to navigate.
the best calculus teacher i took math152 with him again
simplyy the bestt..!!!!!!!!!!
The professor is very interactive and helps out very often. Keeps everyone on there feet to learn and is a brilliant grader.
Best Prof ever!
I LOVE HIM. BEST PROF EVER. 75% = A-,60% = B-. BEST PROF EVER.
If you are good at maths and devote proper time for practice, then you are gonna be just fine.
As most said her lecture notes are incredibly useful! Good teacher as she can give a lot of knowledge-you should just listen and understand

Professor that actually cares about your wellbeing. If you have any issues or concerns he will always try his best to address it. Go to his office hours if you want extra help or free 1 on 1 tutoring; for some reason no one goes to his office hours (a big mistake to capitalize on ). You can expect him to always respond to your emails.

Though he could never finish a lesson and would run out of time (making us have to read written notes for the rest of the examples) He's a nice guy. Tries to answer every question, gives you marks when you think the TA's were unfair, and replies to emails pretty quick. Our final was absurd though (thanks math department...), thank god Justin scaled

was an ok but slow prof. almost always didn't finish the examples in lec and had to post them after. hard exams, failed the course bc i didn't study 10 min quizzes every week which he says are only 2 q's but those had multiple parts, i never finished on time. sometimes he'd give us "extra mins" by 1 (11 mins :/). def study if you take this

Lectures were pretty slow, usually couldn't get through all the notes in time so he had to post them after class. He was pretty good at explaining things though. There are weekly quizzes, but you only get 10 minutes to do "2" questions (they usually had multiple parts to them), but as long as you study for them you shouldn't be too difficult.

he's a decent prof but as others have mentioned his lectures r kinda slow lol, i personally just used his notes more than anything. his tests r pretty hard tbh but if you study (keep up w hw, do textbook questions) you should be able to do fine. his availability outside of class is p good and he responds to emails fast

decent prof however he always gets behind in lecture and takes forever to explain concepts. for example, if there are 10 pages of notes to get through, he'll only get through 4 or 5 of them and end up posting the rest later. exams are pretty hard imo and theres a quiz every week which is a downer

Brenda is not a good math teacher. Most of her lectures are thought of on the spot and they clearly have no planning as her notes are all over the place. She constantly stutters and overexplains simple concepts but struggles explaining difficult ones. She also never answers her emails. Despite all this, she is one of the better math prof at SFU.
Very clear explanations, moderately hard exams. Cant expect better from other profs.

There is nothing I could think of that is bad about Dr. Davison. Her lectures are clear and she explains things very well. She will note anything that she does in an inconspicuous way or further explain why she will proceed with a certain method. You can tell that she puts in effort to teach and that she cares for her classes.
She was totally great! Explained clearly and was super helpful! I recommend everybody taking this course.

Terrible professor. Can't explain things for her life, I'm astonished she's a lecturer. Highest mark on the Math 151 Final was 94%, in a class of 200 intelligent (for the most part) students, with a median grade of 60%. A 94% max for a first year course? Seems wrong to me. Avoid her, trust me!
She is a great prof, teaches the math very well.  Quizzes are based off of homework (good to do them), midterms straight forward, final was a bit tough, but still straight forward nonetheless.

Brenda was extremely knowledgeable. She seems genuinely interested in the subject. Do the homework, and keep up with it. The quizzes are homework questions so don't miss out on those marks. Midterms were straight forward. I have yet to do the final though, hope it's not too hard! Thank god she is teaching 152 next semester!
Really helpful and easy

An extremely personable and engaging professor who really loves math. She explains concepts very clearly. The weekly quizzes are fair, and the 2 midterms are structured the same way as the weekly quizzes. I'm very glad she's also teaching Math 152 next term!
Great Prof. Easy to understand. Anglophone. Explains all examples so well. Test questions are exactly as she says they will be and are directly related to the lectures and homework.
Taking note in class and comprehending assignments are essential. In short, she is nice.

Shes not bad! I had NO calculus background prior and ended up w/ a B which is good. I went to lectures just for notes, study them later, and never asked for help LOL bad student. She had quizzes every friday which forced me to study but they were questions from the hmwk so make sure u do it. midterms= prettyeasy if u understand it. final=hard!

She is very knowledgeable and tries her best to explain the material to her students. But like any math course, you also need to put in your own effort to understand the material. Make sure you understand her notes and the homework problems because that's what her exams are based on. She's a decent lecturer, but lectures may get a bit boring.
at first I thought she was an okay prof but now after doing calc 2 and 3 she's way better at explaining things
Just horrible, feels like she doesn't know what she is doing most of the time. Makes tons of mistakes each class and need students to correct her. Is she even the teacher or the student?
OMG Brenda is the best prof ever at SFU. I had her for first year calculus and I'm absolutely in love with her. <33

I'm hoping that she was just a poor first impression on the Math professors at this school. She barely explains what she's doing and is incredibly dry and monotone. Some of the TAs in the calculus workshop would be better off lecturing this course.
she is some what good, not great. you are better off going to math 150, the proff is better and at least you are not rushing into things
Agreed to the previous comments. I guess it was the first time she taught this course. Hope she never teaches it again.
She is the worst prof ever. I don't know what did the department think before appointing her as an instructor.
She is the most boring instructor I have ever had. She has null teaching skills. Just enters the class and starts writing. Doesn't care to make the already hard course even a bit interesting.

An extremely clear and charistmatic teacher.  Made the material easy to understand, with clear examples.  Class notes are fabulous and a great help.  Also very helpful in the workshop and during office hours.  The best math teacher I have had so far, period.
Good prof with patient, and always glad to help you. Midterms are not easy because of the time limit, but Final is pretty easy.
He's a nice person, but the exams r kinda hard for me :( Overall he is a really good prof

He's pretty funny with a witty sense of humour but as for teaching, who needs lectures when you've got the text? I wish that the material wasn't practically copied and pasted into the class notes. The point of an instructor is to interpret what's in the book in his own way for a better understanding or a better point of view. Totally did not happen
A fairly good teacher. He kept everyone interesting and conveyed the material effectively. Exams seemed easy but fair.

He goes through his notes pretty fast and acts like the students in front of him can do 10 steps of algebra in their mind without him showing the work. His exams are very difficult and are nothing compared to the hw and webassigns he gives.

He's a great prof. As all of the other reviews say he is very good at explaining and made this course very enjoyable. This course was on the easier side for me though as I've taken calc in highschool but it doesn't change the fact that he's an incredible professor.

Goated for a reason. I would suggest not skipping lectures, but if you absolutely have to, you can catch up using canvas. Everything is very clear, both the structure of the course and the material. Just listen to him and ask questions if any. Course mirrors the Stewart textbook so no surprise curveballs. Easy course (compared to other math)

I took calculus last year in high school and hated it, but somehow Jamie made me enjoy it this year (and that says a lot). Great, friendly professor, has office hours in the calc workshop which was helpful for me, takes lots of time explaining concepts in depth. Make sure to do your homework and you'll be fine.
goat of sfu

Jamie Mulholland is the calculus GOAT. He's very approachable and his YouTube videos with great explanations helped my friends and I do well in the course. Midterms and Final were fair as long as you completed the practice tests. Don't miss a chance to take math with this man!! You WILL NOT regret it
Jamie's classes are top-notch - he explains concepts clearly and has great online resources. Using unstuck study and staying engaged made this course a breeze.
The goat of the math department.

You can tell Jamie is an experienced prof. His course and teaching are very organized and clear. He knows what he is talking about and he cares for his students' learning. I loved that he had youtube videos for the whole course, so you can go back for a better understanding or watch in case you slept in.
Jamie is a good teacher. I highly recommend taking it. The only detriment is the early lecture time.

So glad I got into Dr. Mulholland's class for my first year. Heard lots of great things about him and everything was true! He covers content at a good pace and has Youtube videos on everything if you don't understand. Explains everything very well and cares a lot about his students.
Easily the best prof I've had at SFU, I'm mediocre at math but he made it easy for me to understand. Make sure you don't slack for the final since its comparatively harder than the midterms.
You literally can not get a better prof than Jamie. If you have the option to get him as your prof, you are in luck.
He's got amazing lectures, they are very detailed and easy to follow.

Jamie is a great prof that clearly cares about his students and has a passion for teaching. You really don't want to skip his lectures. His quizzes and exams are fair but be sure to practice beforehand and try to avoid careless mistakes (as with any math course). He also has calc 1 and 2 videos on his YouTube channel.

Amazing prof. Clearly cares about teaching and his students. Surprising to find a prof like this teaching a first year course. All of his lectures are recorded on Youtube and explain concepts very clearly. You do have to watch an extra one that's about an hour long every week, but it's helpful. Excellent prof overall.

All his lectures are easy to follow, and he has amazing resources like video lectures to help if you don't understand. Course load was average; online questions and quiz every week. Exams were fair if you did your work and paid attention in class. I've talked to him outside of lecture and he is super nice and cares about his students.

Would give him 11/10 if I could. He's nothing short of amazing. Not once did I walk out of a lecture confused: everything is explained in the clearest way possible and his class is very well-organized. I've never had a better teacher. His exams definitely aren't easy but they're very fair. :) :) :)

Jamie Mulholland is an excellent prof. I've been fortunate to have some great math teachers, however, Jamie takes the cake for accessibility and clarity. If questions from WebAssign or the after-video quizzes were generally not understood by the class, Jamie would go over it in detail during lecture. His youtube channel is a great resource as well.

A real beast (a compliment) at math and teaching. Each lecture is like a Ted talk; it's so exciting! Really complete the homework and go to the Calculus workshop to receive clarification upon lecture notes, if u need. He has all lectures pre-recorded on youtube, so you can skip, or one can clarify upon a particular section of the notes #bestteacher

A really good choice for a calc prof. Midterms and final were fair. There are weekly quiz questions so make sure you do webassign and the extra questions. TA's were helpful in the workshop. Make sure you practice optimization and related rates as these are probably the hardest concepts in the course. There are iclicker participation questions.
His online lectures are extremely useful and the homework that is assigned is directly applicable to his weekly quizzes as well as the midterms. Best prof I had this semester by far.
His videos are extremely well organized and his lectures simplify calculus in a way that I can actually understand. He also taught me to solve a rubiks cube. 10/10
Amazing prof! Very easy to listen to in lecture and his notes are great, do the assignments and some extra practice and you'll be fine. He's also really helpful in office hours!

Extremely good professor, try to take any classes you can with him. I got a poor mark because I didn't put enough effort in, but it's clear that if you do the work he recommends you will succeed. The exams are quite fair, though the final had a lot of emphasis on the last topics, so make sure you know everything. Go to the TA's if you need help.

Great prof, loves math and cares about the students. Went above and beyond to help, spent far more time helping students than any other prof I've had. Additionally, he kept things interesting by  making fun/creative problems that highlighted real life connections to course content. If you can choose, take it with Jamie, you will not be disappointed

He's one of the best profs I've ever met! I took his course on the first term of my first year and it was fantastic! Take the course with him if it's possible. His explanation makes all questions super easy!!
Very nice prof, take his class if you can!

Jamie is my overall favourite prof so far at SFU.  His method of teaching made class interactive and fun as well as informative.  Tests were fair for the most part, just make sure to study.  He truly enjoys his job and loves interacting with students and that's why I would recommend him to anyone!
It is essential to come to class because he explains the material very well. He's a great prof
Amazing prof, very passionate, I would recommend taking his classes!

Absolutely amazing prof, he gives an unnecessary amount of study material and provides an excellent note package at the beginning of the year to fill in throughout the semester. He encourages you to ask questions and he is great at clarifying every point. The class isn't too difficult and it's mostly due to his excellent teaching style!
One of the best profs ever! He's so passionate about the course and his students. If you see a class with him as a prof, TAKE IT!
I am not very strong in math but Dr. Mulholland makes calculus clear and easy to understand. Words can't describe how awesome he is. If you see a course with him as a teacher, TAKE IT.
Best prof ever !!
He is the best prof. I had in sfu!

One of the best prof I have ever seen.A very dedicated and passionate professor, who loved the course materials and is always fully prepared. Last time I saw him trying to help students till 1:15pm in the workshop even though his working hour was only from 10:30am-12:30am.
Rating says it all. Best prof ever
He is a very good prof, if he teach other math courses, I would follow with him!
Really nice teacher

Really caring, her routine worked well for me. However, due to unforeseen circumstances I was unable to pass this class(presumably, I haven't taken the exam yet, but I need like an 80% to get a decent final mark)

Ok I skipped like 90% of the lectures and managed to get an A. Anyone who actually attempted the HW should get at least 90% on midterm. The stewert book is so good at teaching and pair that with the solution manual you're set! In fact i skipped even most of calc 1, and calc 3 lectures.

VERY VERY FAST DO NOT SKIP! SKIP THEN YOU ARE DOOMED. Gives out ok midterms but a final that i would like to drop a F bomb on... a total of 3 proving questions and 2 weird funcions. Go for her to maximize your knowledge in math... despite the fact that she is quite uh... unfriendly during lectures.

She's very clear and organized. Don't ask a question in her lecture - you're always wrong, she's always right ... which is good if you want to learn to do things the right way! Her exams were very fair. If you happen to go on to take 152 from Tariq YOU WILL MISS HER
the worst teacher in the world
she's FAST FAST FAST FAST, you dont wanna miss any of her lecture..you'll fall way behind if you miss one class. but she's clear and very organized..
Very good prof. She really knew what she was teaching.Go to her lecture even though it is in the early morning.Her midterm is fair, but not her final exam.
She's an excellent prof. She's clear, direct and organized. Her notes are like the bible of succeeding calculus. Yupz, they are better than the text.

Her midterms are easy but the final is quite difficult.  There are quite a lot of notetaking, so prepare to write and jot down notes quickly.  Her jokes at the end of class are usually quite refreshing after a long lecture.
@@" but she was too fast in her last few sections...><
she did a horrible job on the last section of my course, skimmed through 3 chapters at god speed.  but turns out, it wasn't on the finals so she's ok i guess.
She is a good professor. This course gives fair midterms but tricky final exams!

She is a crazy lady but her midterms are fair and easier than anticipated. She expects you to know things without really explaining them though and zooms right through her explanations sometimes. A hard course if you haven't taken any high school calculus before but if you have you should be fine.
MATH is so hard.... but the examples she teaches is somwhat related to the exams...exams are really hard tho...oh yeh.. her yelling is scary...!
She's SUPER SMART and has so much power over the class. but she's a good prof overall.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Really great person and teacher

She is one of the best profs of Maths. She has great lectures and if you attend attentively, you will grasp everything easily and wouldn't need outside help. She even solves every doubt in class and even the midterm papers and quizzes. She gave out printed notes and materials to help even more. She is the best, don't think twice.
The quizzes are always easy, and the exam is not that hard as well. Her handwriting is really nice, and she will hand out the material for each class, so it's no need to print it by yourself.
She is really great for math151. She give good lectures and handouts.
she teaches the class clearly and never get angry when the student ask her questions. She also gives grade easily
Those who blame her are not really doing their homework carefully.

Nadia is so sweet! I like her rule ( if someone's phone rings in the class, then this person will take snacks to all classmates next class.) for snack, just kidding:) The quizzes, midterms and final are not too hard. just do homework and think.

Amazing professor. Excellent at teaching and clarifying doubts. NOTE she will not be taking summer and fall 2017 and will only return in winter 2018 PS: COOKIES ;D (people who have taken her courses will understand)
She is patient for all of the questions. Sometimes she makes me confused, but thats not her fault because the cource is difficult.

Well as the name shows, she is Persian. Nadia was one of the best teachers I've ever had. Amazing lectures ; she does not make you confused. On the other hand, she is ready to explain a problem to you as many as you want. Quizzes and midterms are just like the home works, however doing homework is not mandatory, but it's better for you to do them.

Amazing lecturer, passionate, but definitely has some problematic ways of running the course. 

Rather than releasing weekly textbook questions along with the weekly WebAssigns, he releases all those weeks worth of textbook questions a week before every exam. 

Never once has replied to an email of mine.

Other than that, he's a great CALC2 prof.

Very enthusiastic teacher, you can tell he really enjoys teaching Math. He likes to bring up real-life concepts to show that what we learn in Calculus is actually very closely connected to the real world.

You need to practice a lot on your own!! He explain things really well and makes calc easy. He seems to have bad days but still manages to give great lectures. Make use of the calc workshop and get lots of practice.
Very good class, easy exams and no surprises. Show up for lectures, study and you will do well. Very good professor

Professor Devos is oftentimes disorganized and seems to have off days, however, overall, he seems to have a great passion for mathematics and likes to point out applications in the real world to make it more interesting. He teaches a tough course, but I feel like he, himself is a great teacher despite his quirks.

He's a really good prof, very helpful. He explain everything so clearly, if you are not a math person, he's a good prof to take. He doesn't act like you're stupid if you don't understand something. He tries to help out as much as possible.
very fun, very nice, made me really enjoy math

Simply one of the best math profs. The midterms were very easy and very clear. Just do the HW problems. I don't know about the final. We'll have to wait and see. He makes calculus very easy. Great job.

Very Clear and concise lectures, doesn't bore you with useless notes. He really knows how to get across his points to the class. Good at keeping you interested in the material b/c he gives lots of applications. He makes funny drawings. GREAT PROF!!

Yeah! It's so funny when he plots graphs with his arms. His examples are very down to earth. He is good at explaining why things are the way they are, and he really makes you understand what he is saying. He makes getting up at 6:30 to make it to class worth the effort. Very glad I got to take this class with him.

his examples are clear, makes few mistakes, funny guy he plots graps on overhead and with his body =D , tho inclass he gives few examples, yet their very descriptive. good guy , seems very excited about teaching

Good prof. He seems a bit unsure about how to explain some things; I think he's new to teaching. Really funny though. One day he wanted to emphasize something, so he started jumping up and down to get our attention. Still waiting for the first midterm to see how hard it will be, but he seems very friendly and fair.
No Comments
She should be able to pass the midterms herself before she decides to give it to the students.

Shes clearly very new to teaching and makes VERY FREQUENT mistakes. Also she will rewrite an equation over and over just to show her work for (1+4)  5 for example, and the notes are so cluttered to the point of being useless. Insists on doing every bit of notation the long way for no reason. The natural log of instead of saying ln. She nice tho

She is really good at explaining things clearly and I would always recommend taking her courses. She is really caring and will always help those in need. She takes a lot of surprise quizzes but if you follow her lectures and practice the homework questions, you should be fine.

She is a good professor. besides, her midterms papers are so easy. Thats why the level of difficulty becomes very higher when it comes to final exam. Because we are not even tested by such hard paper in the class ! I felt everything is fine except her testing question in the class! She should make testing questions way harder than it is now!

Nice person but one of the worst professors I have had so far. Exams are nothing like the study material and she gave confusing information on what was to be tested. So many other better Calc I profs.

Calculus 1 with sophie is quite difficult. Make sure you keep on top of the WebAssign/crowdmark homework stuff, it is easy marks and good practice. You won't succeed in this class if you study the night before each test. After every lecture, review the notes and watch Jamie Mulholland's youtube videos for clarification. Midterms and exams are hard.

Sophie is a nice and understanding prof. If you have taken Calculus previously it should be fine as long as you are organized and do all the work. The 10 min quizzes at the end of class can be overwhelming but know the material well. The final was a bit complicated and different from the practice exams, but doable if confident with your math skills

Sophie was super kind and encouraging in class. If you have taken calculus before, math 151 shouldn't be too bad. Stay on top of the homework and quizzes, then you'll be fine. 
My only complaint is that she can sometimes be a bit disorganized (not finishing lesson on time), and grading can be slow.

I find explanation of solving certain questions a bit lacking but overall good experience with this prof. She streams her lectures which is great for 8:30 am classes. seems to be active outside of class but do all assigned work and practices because the lectures arent enough to get you a good grade

Sophie is a wonderful person. However, advanced concepts were not touched on in class, but ended up on the midterm/final. Pretty much expected to figure it out on your own. Quizzes and homework were fair. Must have very solid Pre-calculus knowledge to succeed.
Good teacher but tends to explain useless information.

Sophie Burrill is a very nice person. The content in homework, quizzes and lectures is not reflective whatsoever of what you are being assessed on for midterms and the final. Advanced concepts are ignored (even in sample finals) and appear in exams, assuming that you magically learnt how to do it. There are negative reviews here for a reason.

Sophie is a very nice person, but her teaching style can be very frustrating. She does not give priority to key concepts that appear all throughout the course. The quizzes can be relatively easy, but the midterms and final are overly hard. They are nothing like what has been taught or practiced. There are negative reviews here for a reason.

Originally I was very scared of this prof due to her rating. But she turned out to be super amazing! Her lecture were  available online, she was nice, she tested what she taught, she replied quickly, was easily accessible, and she taught well. The only thing is that she has weekly quizzes and multiple assignments due weekly.

Extremely kind and caring professor. The 1 star reviews are left by NPC's. She teaches in a very human way that you can understand and gives just enough examples to get across the main point without overwhelming. Homework heavy.
The best math teacher ever .Would highly recommend.

Aside from quizzes, there is almost no reason to show up to lectures. Her and Jamie Mulholland's lecture videos are more than enough to learn the content. Quizzes would either be super tough or really easy and the exams weren't too tough. Sophie explained things well but would often go on side tangents so lots of lecture time was lost.

Not as bad as some people say. Lectures are not great but good enough. Read the textbook and watch videos on the stuff she does not cover. Do all the homework. Tests are extremely fair. Do the provided exam practice! Main issue is she doesn't structure lecture time effectively.

Sophie sucks as a prof. She makes everything about social justice, even though it's a calc class. The material itself is relatively easy, I don't ever go to lectures and just watch prof. Mullholland's YouTube lectures (MUCH BETTER). She doesn't go in depth into any of her lectures, and rarely covers all the planned materials for lectures. 1/10 prof

Tries to be nice and friendly but don't be fooled, she doesn't teach properly, explanations are vague and unhelpful, she expects this to be your only class. oh and midterms are 40 minutes with 10 minutes to upload in the morning. (40% of your grade depends on 80 minutes and you being up early)

Sophie is literally the definition of your stereotypical Math teacher. She cares about the students and encourages help be sought when necessary. Her tests and assignments are also fair in difficulty with respect to the course. If you enjoy what typical math teachers are like you will enjoy Sophie as a prof.
No Comments
More concerned with germs on busses than teaching calculus.
I came to class to learn calculus, Not to be told about some lecture you went to or how you came from texas.
No Comments
MATH 4xx students: Somehow you have confused  first year students  who  don't know much about mathematics  with people who don't know what's boring and what ain't.  We're just telling it like it is.
Nice guy but he's really dry and has a boring motonuous (spelling?)voice. And his teaching doesn't seem confident.
Nice guy, but can't teach. Rather read the text, is more helpful.
nice guy, not too hard to understand, but very confusing when he writes derivations and decides at the end that its wrong.
if u have lost points in midterms, go to find him. most likely he will give back your points even though u are wrong technically.
Unable to communicate ideas well
No Comments
easy course, but prof goes into derivations of unrelated things,not clear at all
um......he is  nice ....but he can't teach
worst prof i've ever head
No Comments
a nice pro
If u can choose to hav another prof...choose another one....
Weird sense of humor and very absentminded
he uses identical examples as the book..cept book is clearer
focuses on theorectical side of calculus. quite helpful, but a bit absentminded
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
has strange sense of humor
fair prof, good notes, good teaching style :)
Excellent prof!  His clear examples during lecture really help in assignments.
Very good notes. Very good lecturer. Fair exams. Very helpful. Has slight accent but totally understandable and clear. Super nice and gives great examples.
he is a really good prof... my friends skipped their own math class just to listen to him because he is very clear and give so much examples that it is easy to do the homework he assigned.
Very organized teacher with awsome notes. Notes are just like high school. He answers questions somewhat well, but sometimes tells you to read the text book as you should already know it.
If you haven't taken high school calculus, don't take this class. Hard as hell. The prof is helpful and after every other step he asks for questions (rarely are any however)
Good prof.  Very structured and organized notes.  Tends to assume knowledge.

Very structured, and relevant notes. When asked questions in class he clearly explains them. However, his course is not easy, even after doing highschool calculus. Be prepared to really understand the principles behind CalculusI or you won't do well.

very nice and willing to help; notes are organized, except he does his algebraic steps very fast, which will be fine as long as you concentrate and keep your mind sharp (sometimes hard to do at 8:30 am in the morning -_-).
enthusiastic
No Comments

Prof has high interest in subject, but unable to clearly communicate the concepts. As an example, I once asked him a LON CAPA question, he was unable to get the right answer and said he would "omit" it (but he never did). I then asked one of the TA's in the calc workshop and she was able to quickly clarify the soluion for me.
Useless prof...... he puts questions in midterms you will find nowhere.... nothing from textbook....
dont take it
Good Man. Okayish prof
Nils Bruin always does a decent job teaching. The weekly quizzes helped me understand what I did and did not know. Exams were hard but fair. Nils was always available for questions after class.
The lecture wasn't clear and often make mistakes
Horrible at explaining even if he tries to, makes mistakes on his own lecture examples. Dont take it with him unless you wanna teach yourself everything.

Worst prof ever. Learned the whole course by myself as his lectures makes the material more confusing than it needs to be. Hand writes all of his lecture notes in cursive so if you can't read cursive, good luck. Makes plenty of mistakes during lectures and just scribbles them out.

Nils Bruin must've cheated his way through school because his knowledge of first-year calculus is unimaginably bad that many students know more than him and have to correct his mistakes during lectures. He is also probably eats McDonalds every day with a belly the size of 5 basketballs.

You can tell Nils is trying to do his best when teaching, but he's just not that good. He struggles to explain things, and he often dances around students' questions. He depends on lecture videos from another professor rather than teaching himself. His lecture isn't that useful but he does grade participation so you should go.

bruin can't explain a concept without butchering a part of it. his handwriting is also super distressing to your eyes. avoid this prof unless you have a good knowledge of course concepts before the class starts. the quizzes and exams are doable if you study religiously but the lectures are super hard to sit through

Dr. Bruin is not the best at teaching. His tests can be tricky at times but it is doable as long as you put in the work outside of class and do other problems. I strongly suggest watching Jamie Mulholland's Calc I series on YouTube as Nils' lectures are merely a condensed of those videos. P.S. There is a quiz every week on the previous content.
Gives useless in-class poll questions, makes tons of mistakes, and his writing is impossible to read. Do not take this if you're not required to.

Having a Ph.D. does not equate to being a good teacher. Lectures were disastrous and only worth attending due to participation questions. Professor Bruin's explanations were confusing at best, and often times riddled with errors that students had to correct him on. Virtually any other resource was more beneficial than his classes.

decent professor. Although, you must rely heavily on your textbook to prepare for exams and not just lecture material and homework questions. he has poll questions during lectures, but they barely count towards your grade.

Avoid! This professor is terrible at explaining or communicating anything, whether it be math concepts or course information. His communication skills might the worst out of any Phd graduate I've ever seen. He barely teaches in lectures and just scribbles chicken scratch for a few examples. He also made the final so much harder than the midterms.

I thought I would be coming to SFU to listen to awesome math professors talk, but Nils Bruin is a complete abomination of a professor. He does not understand how to organize or teach properly. His lectures are filled with these poll questions that count for 8 percent of your mark and are impossible to answer in the 1 minute he gives you. Terrible!

His polls were really confusing. I didn't even bother listening to his lectures, just did the polls and ignored his explanations. Actually, he is a nice guy and if you go to his OH, he will be happy to help you. I got 100% for my Calc 12 but still had to work really hard, so do your homework, watch Jamie's lectures and you will be fine.

You have to attend the useless lectures to answer poll questions. He will try to explain the question after everyone answers and will 9/10 times do the question wrong and confuse everyone. What was really a drag was that the final was done basically completely on polar coordinates which was the last section done and we had no practice on it.
goat
Good prof, class is easy as long as you review/study the material and attend the lectures. The final was tough but he scaled it down to make it fairer.

Mandatory videos to watch the week before in order to survive often unfair required poll questions (8% of grade) Prof Bruins "lectures" are just mainly focused on these polls, and slightly reviewing the videos (which are not even his). Weekly timed exams (10m limit, gl) Very big final (45% of grade) Sad I need 152 now, same prof, lost my drive :/

Bruin is obviously a good researcher. However, his apathy in his lectures is obvious. He uses poll questions as a way to mark your participation. However, the poll questions are often poorly designed and presuppose knowledge of material that hasn't been covered yet in class. On the other hand, TA's are very helpful will explain material thoroughly.

Pretty nice guy and definitely smart, but just because you know the topic doesn't mean you can be a good prof. Terrible lectures, they're a mess. Learned more from youtube videos than from watching this guy's lectures :(
Horrible prof. Makes simple concepts more complicated than they really are. Better off watching Jaime Mulholland's vids.
Nice and intimate professor if you think Math is a sacrilegious joke in human history.

If there was a worst teacher award, it would go to Dr Bruin because this guy is probably the worst teacher I have ever seen. He makes so many mistakes in lectures that students always have to step up and correct his mistakes. When he tries to explain anything, he stumbles on his words and cannot articulate complete sentences without messing up.

If you don't go to class, it is -8 percent because of Bruin's poll questions. But Bruin's classes are an absolute pain. He is an atrocious professor, he cannot articulate and explain anything properly. He has these poll questions in class which are super hard and no one knows how to do them. Avoid Bruin if you can because he is excruciatingly bad.

Nils Bruin uses polls to ensure attendance, however, they can be extremely difficult applications of a formula or problem-solving technique we haven't covered yet. Apart from the polls, the quizzes and even midterms are quite concise and representative of textbook material.

Bruin is a fine professor. If you watch the pre-lectures (as he asked) and do the homework (as he asked) and if you aren't a whiny b*tch, you'll do fine on tests/quizzes/polls. Polls are easy if you watch the pre-lectures and read the textbook. Just be prepared to put in the work.

Nils Bruin is a terrible professor. He does not understand how to teach. His classes are filled with poll questions on concepts that haven't been taught. He also has the most incomprehensible writing I've ever seen. During lectures, he makes so many mistakes that students have to correct him it's insane. Avoid this professor, he cannot do his job.
Nils Bruin is a pretty solid professor. He is always very caring and always tries to answer students' questions to the best of "his ability". And his quizzes always only have two questions!

Nils Bruin is an absolute embarrassment of SFU. He is the worst professor I've ever seen! His ability to explain anything is downright nonexistent and his writing is worse than the worst chicken scratch. His classes are filled with poll questions that count for 8 percent of your mark and are on concepts that aren't even covered yet. WORST PROF EVER

nils bruin is an absolute joke of a professor its ridiculous. this guy covers very little in his lectures and has super hard poll questions which he never teaches. and he also cant explain any concepts well. his writing is so bad it looks like an alien language. never take a class with bruin he will make your brain explode.

his online poll questions are ridiculously hard and barely pertain to what he teaches on the day, if you dont read the textbook or watch the lectures beforehand youre screwed. doesnt help that his writing is unreadable either, find a class with a different teacher if you can.

this man got into the wrong career. he doesn't understand what teaching is. he reads off his slides and then writes chicken scratch. he also frequently skips a lot of content and doesn't help students when they ask questions. don't take a class with this professor, you will regret it.

Nils Bruin seems to be very knowledgeable of Mathematics, but his ability to teach is worse than if a kindergarten teacher tried to teach special relativity. Nils Bruin cannot explain anything even remotely well. He stumbles on every sentence and his handwriting is the worst handwriting I've ever seen. Avoiding Bruin is a must, Bruin is terrible!

Nils Bruin is a terrible prof who can't execute a proper lecture. He constantly makes mistakes when doing examples and students have to correct him. He takes so long to do examples that he never finishes covering all the material during lectures and has to skip parts of the unit. He ignores most questions from students and has brutal handwriting.

How is Nils Bruin a professor is my question. This guy can't explain anything even remotely well. His classes are extremely hard poll questions that are worth almost 10 percent of your mark. He gives tough quizzes every week and only gives you ten minutes to do them. So if at any time during the quiz you get stuck, you are done for. AVOID BRUIN PLS
This man could somehow make explaining 1+1 a challenge, that is, if you can read his hand writing. Avoid this prof at all costs

as a pretty honest student, this professor is well..... very very bad. I would skip his lectures, because he can't teach to save his life, but you need to do his poll questions. I cannot believe my tuition went towards this goof. as a person, he's pretty ok, but as a professor he's garbage.

Nils Bruin is a terrible professor and his classes are horrendous. Avoid this professor at all costs! They way he teaches is incomprehensible. He goes super fast and doesn't explain anything. Every class he has these poll questions which are super hard and on things he hasn't even taught yet. Just watch the Mulholland videos and you might be fine.

Never take a class with Nils Bruin, he is a terrible professor. His classes are basically students asking him questions and him failing to answer any questions properly. You are expected to watch pre-recorded lectures and then know how to answer all the super hard poll questions in class. He teaches nothing and has hard quizzes once a week.

Nils Bruin is the worst math professor at SFU, hands down. He is unable to explain anything properly, and whenever he tries to explain anything, he stumbles on his words, and his handwriting is egregious. He seems to be an expert in math, but teaching is not his strength. He literally skims through lecture slides and laughs at student's questions.

Nils Bruin is one of the worst profs I have had. He is unable to articulate concepts and thus explains things terribly or does not explain things at all. His handwriting is also terrible which does not help his lackluster teaching skills. His lectures are basically him skimming through lecture notes. Avoid Dr. Bruin if you can.

This teacher is the worst math teacher Ive ever had. His online lessons are a boring slog and are only attended by the majority of students because of polls. The slides he presents only overcomplicate concepts. His writing is poor, cannot communicate his thoughts well despite knowing the concepts, and is not enthusiastic. Misses parts of units too

To be fair it might have been cause of the online classes, however he failed to explain problems thoroughly. Also midterms and final exam were way harder than what he had explained and prepared us for.
He's a nice dude. Quizzes and exams were easy.

please avoid him!! Have to attend every online class to do the poll questions even though they're not related to the tests. Practice exams are useless because he won't test about Midterms are long and you may not have time to finish them. Final is the worst. There are some questions that's not on practice exams and I have no idea what they are.

PLEASE AVIOD THIS PROFESSOR This is the worst math class I have ever had. He never taught any useful examples in the class. He gave you 3-4 poll questions that is super hard and worth 8% of grades. I have just done my final, it is 45% of the grade and seems like he just wants everyone to get an F. If you reading this,happy holiday, hope you pass
Seems like a nice enough dude

Honestly the worst teacher i've ever had. The most unprofessional, unorganized, and the laughing stock of the sfu math department. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE ESPECIALY ONLINE. TAKE 150. this proves how terrible sfu is at sciences compared to UBC's super professional and high quality stature. no wonder why they are respected in math and sciences.

Literally learn nothing during lectures, but you have to go because he does poll questions for marks. His hand writing sucks and he overcomplicates things way too much. Luckily I took calc in high school cuz I'd 100% fail otherwise.

Worst teacher ever in my entire life. Students always correct his mistakes. Never make any concept clear, and spend more than half of class time on poll question after 1 minute's concept explanation. Also, he "hmmmm"s a lot, sounds like he never prepare what he tries to say. Terrible class experience. SELF STUDY DOES MUCH BETTER JOB.

Literally the whole time he would do clicker questions and any example he would do, he would do it wrong. Probably one of the worst profs I've ever had. I took calc in high school and got a 90 and I literally failed somehow, he gives so many assignments and on top of that you have to teach yourself. Do not take this with him its horrendous.

He makes the most simple things super complicated had to do everything by myself and ask my questions in the calculus workshop because the lectures weren't useful AT ALL. This teacher obviously knows his stuff but he is not good at all at teaching it. I think he might have chosen the wrong profession.
eeeeek!!

Oh My God...I don't know why he is teaching=.= The worst Profesor ever!!! His writing...don't need to say anything more, just a word=terrible. Also the way he teach...SUPER BORING...especially the morning class at 8:30, there are no ways that make you stay awake...overall, just a terrible prof!
Very good at complicating things...

I just had my final. what should I say, he is responsible for my failure. (didn't fail but definately not great) many questions on stuff he spent 2 mins in lectures, and some even not in lecture notes :(. I guess people in his class are on our own.

He's not THAT mean, but his writing is quite terrible. Also can't understand him through an accent and him mumbling. Makes it a pain in the rear if you sit further back. Not too bad if you've taken calculus, but if not, steer clear.
Most of my friends hated this guy so much they went to the other guy's class every day.  I stayed put, loyally.  He's not as bad as people say, but he's definitely not great either.

the class itself may not be as hard as you think, but this guy could be the worst prof you've ever seen. horrible lectures and notes. I would rather wait for a semester even if the course is compulsory.
Help.

I had him for two classes and I was wanting out: no idea what he was talking about or writing about(my high school teacher does a better job!), messy notes.  Thank god I was not alone. This was my first year in university and I thought this was the way of it.  Thank god it was only him...hopefully.

He was a great prof. He made the "CALCULUS" fun class.He was always ready to help out and was a very fair marker.The exams were really hard especially Final.Although Final was very hard and I didn't get a good mark, I paseed it because everyone else did bad :). So, he has a really good marking scheme.I would love to have him as a professor again.

Good prof.  He knows what he's teaching and explain the material very clearly.  To top it off, he's funny and that really help you stay awake at a 8:30am lecture.  Final was very hard but it doesn't matter if everyone else did bad at it anyway.  You'll get a pretty good grade if you do all the practises. Oh, and he's pretty hot.

A clown makes you laugh all semester long then it turns into tears when u get ur grades. For first year students if you didn't calculus in high school for the love of GPA GOD Avoid this tuurdd. This guy is a joke of a prof ur better off learning from the book, he makes mistakes and his exams arent anything like the quizzes or HW. You have my wisdom

He's a decent lecturer and you might not be able to understand some of his methods of education. However, it is easy to pass this course, let alone get at least a B. Trust me, just go to classes and you will do fine. Remember to learn basic examples for the final!
This class is GPA Booster. It is easier than Math 150. You do not need textbook to pass this course. You just need to listen to the lectures and that's all.
May as well just teach yourself. He only copies examples directly from the textbook without any clarification or explanation.
He gave us a challenge.

Amazing professor.  The first time I took 151 I dropped it because it was confusing but once I took it with Goddyn everything was crystal clear and I ended up getting a really high grade! He's a funny guy with a lot of character and makes all the material very interesting.
No Comments
BAD BAD Prof, mistakes never end, very unclear, tries to make things simple but instead confuses you more. Tests are fair but he doesn't know how to teach!
i think the prof is pretty good ... just he makes mistakes sometimes.  i think he midterms and finals r not that bad.
not recommended...the thing i like about him is when he says "ARRRGGGHH" when he makes mistakes...
This prof is not recommanded
Notes are vague, disorganized and hard to follow.

he is a good prof. he does make mistakes while teaching but i m ok with tht. but if u see the test he prepare, wht the hell... everything outside the book.  questions are given which u haven't even seen b4. TA look 4 the final answer.no part marking.
Extremely disorganized, always late and makes a tremendous amount of mistakes during lecture. Definitely not the best person to be teaching math.
He makes so many mistakes it's not even funny.. one per lecture on average.  He's a good guy though, just a bit scatterbrained.  I hope I don't have him for MATH 152 next semester...
Great Teacher!!
good teacher.. he kept me awake every morning for 8:30 lecture. sometimes he's a little hard to follow.. but he keeps it interesting.
he's not that hard for the exam, but for lecture...
he doesn't know what he is doing, make stuff more confusing, make silly jokes
No Comments
No Comments
He's one of the best math profs I've had

Knows his stuff very well. Heavy accent, but you will get used to it in a week or two. (Be sure to tell him to use a mic in class. The mic helped us immensely.) Tests are fair and easy.  Class averages stayed above 70% the whole semester.
He seems like a nice human being, but his teaching skills are subpar.
Nah this teacher sucks.she speaks like a radio hey class pauses right pauses cmon man what the heck

Elena is amazing when it comes to grading and giving feedback. She's very knowledgeable, but sometimes her voice can make you a bit sleepy. Still, I definitely recommend her—she doesn't deserve all the bad reviews. If you study and work hard, especially using the lecture notes and her exam reviews, you'll do well and get good grades!

Please honestly reflect on how much you've actually studied. Most of the test questions are ones we've already covered in class handout. You can't expect to get good grades without doing your homework. I've seen, it seems like 70% of students want to get good grades without studying even though they have the ability to study.

awful, awful, awful. the worst prof ive ever had. makes everything more difficult for no reason. tests are ridiculous. doesn't teach in class and relies on jamies recorded lectures. strict and unnecessary grader. unreasonable human being. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!
not recommended
A lot of self learning in this course but tests are based on textbook problems. So if you practice textbook questions you can score good.
Great professor, always willing to help students, and very generous in marking.
Elena is very sweet and so are her lectures. The loads of homework you get is for you to get well prepared for the exams. If you do everything she says, you will be able to get good grades.
Useful handouts, clear instructions, concise and yet effective way of teaching. Do not miss the videos and do a maximum of homework questions. Thank you for the inspiration, Elena!

Great professor. She does not really explain the stuff in class, but honestly i think it's for the best since u can speed up video lectures (plus those lectures are great). She is there to help and explain when you need her. The assignment she gives is comprehensive and she marks it all.

She is the worst teacher one can have for math. Gives long assignments filled with lengthy questions, then asks tough questions on the exam and refuses to elaborate on the criteria based on which she assigns students marks. She blatantly asks us to watch videos of another prof at SFU named Jamie, even during class. Nothing is covered during class.

I took Elena last semester, while she is very kind her lectures are not easy to understand, and you are expected to watch other lecture videos from other professors before the class. She will only give a small summary of the topic and let you work on homeworks or excercises.

She barely teaches anything, you must read the content that she provides or the textbook before coming to class. She will mostly answer doubts and talk about the bits of the content. Until now, classes are basically a mandatory 4-hour "office hour:"
Doesn't teach in person, expects us to watch video lectures that are NOT by her, but rather Khan Academy and other lectures. Heavy assignment workload. Avoid her by all cost

Actually I have basic knowledge of calculus so I didnt watch her videos and only read the textbook myself. However, I think she is quit nice when I joined her office hours and the homework actually is needed for your own practice. The exam questions are reasonable if you done her homework from textbook!

Work hard , listen to all lectures and more importantly do things on time . You will get an A - easily . Elena is so kind , she responds to all your doubts . But the only thing bad about Elena is she doesnt teach us , she tell us to look for DR Jamies videos for the whole semester. This is really annoying. Jamie Mullohands lecture are super.
She does not explain clearly

I am currently taking asynchronous class and prof Elena is the one who is SUPPOSED to teach me but in reality, it's youtube and khan academy that's been helping me, She only put out lectures for like just 2 weeks and those were too short and with bad audio. She just posts links to youtube vids and khan academy. Please never take her async class.

Hi , Dr. Halmaghi was one of the best professor I had in my first semester. She is very kind. At first of her class , the assignments were a bit heavy but as she went further , the assignments got less. The quizzes and final exam's questions are easy if you do all the assignments carefully and absorb her lectures.

Took her online course and I really had the toughest times of my life coping up. No lecture videos, plenty of assignments, no solution to the problems. Instead, she would ask me to watch khan academy and other sources to take help from. I really don't know why would anyone even pay for her course. On the flip side tho, she's a nice human being.
"i will leave this to your capable hands"

I thought Dr. K was a great professor. Her exams are incredibly fair, and as long as you attend the lectures, (ALL OF THEM, especially at the end of the semester), you'll do good. She highlights types of questions you will see on exams, and some of the hw she gives- specifically the seminar hw, will be v similar to the quizzes.  Good luck!!

If you have never taken calculus before in university then this course with Dr. K might be very challenging. Each day she covered a brand new topic and mostly skimmed through the intro and did the easy examples, therefore when doing homework, such as webassign and crowdmark seminars, the difficulty of the questions was a lot harder.

She was pretty good at teaching but would often rush through the lecture and skip over hard details. You have to be very specific in your answers to receive full marks and she was never inviting to ask questions.

Medium difficulty exam/quizzes; fair final. Messy notes. Says he does not curve or scale but scaled the final grades. Very accessible during office hours (barely anyone goes). Rambles too much. A hard class for students with no calc experience; decent for students with. Calc is a self-taught class regardless of prof. Be ready to study a lot.

I am a first-year who has prior knowledge of calculus and I struggled in this course. Pyke's lectures are subpar, he doesn't finish the examples even though the remaining steps aren't clear. The homework is fair, (98%) but the quizzes are absolutely crazy, there are 10 minutes to do 2 insane questions (47). I would suggest another prof for math151
Horrible teacher with extremely hard exams and quizzes, impossible to do well.

Let me start off by saying I got 100% in Calc 12 in high school. Even so, I acknowledge the transition from high school will drop my grades. However, the only reason I am surviving this course is because of my calc 12 background. This professor does not teach and his notes are illegible. Most people learn off of Youtube. Avoid at ALL costs.

I was shocked to see that Randall Pyke was my new professor after I was informed my professor was on a leave. I broke down to tears after seeing the sheer reviews on this man. And boy were they true, please if you want to be happy in life do not take this teacher. Take this as a warning, DO NOT TAKE PYKE.

Randall Pyke is a one of a kind professor. His quizzes and exams are extremely challenging with questions that are much harder than the homework. There are barely any ways to make up the marks so expect this class to bring down your GPA if you are even able to pass. The prof also isn't scaling this class so that doesn't help either.

I dont normally go out of my way to write reviews but please take this as a HUGE WARNING. Stay away from Dr. Pyke. Course content is not that difficult but his lectures and unorganized notes make them extremely confusing. Homework and exams are also super difficult. (TAs often get confused with his questions) You are better off teaching yourself.

He is A-MAZING!! Last semester he taught me Math 150, and this semester even though he's not teaching he still comes up to campus to help me with math 152 homework (that he's not even in charge of teaching!). He's super caring and very approachable, if you don't understand something always ask! His explanations are da bomb

Very unclear when explaining concepts and lectures are all over the place. The homework load is also very heavy, and since lectures are not helpful, youll need to seek outside sources to understand the material. If you can, stay away from this prof.

At first, he seems like a very nice and caring professor. Although it's natural for everyone to make mistakes, the later on we go in the term the more mistakes he makes, especially when the subject really matters. Also, very harshly graded and not graves. Don't take this class if there are other profs available.

very difficult prof. cannot teach at all. midterms and exams are difficult - he expects you to be able to do what he is capable of. confuses himself easily and tends to fall behind in lectures. (rushes during the end of the semester). get above average on everything and you will be alright.

makes a couple of mistakes in class and he wont fix them unless u find out its wrong.  but how can u do that if its an intro to math class, u dont know anything about it.  hes a good speaker and knows how to teach more than what the textbook gives.  but midterms and finals are difficult and time consuming.  questions take more time to read than do.
toooo hard

A nice guy who gets kudos for showing up to teach kids calculus every day at 8:30 AM... but that's where the praise ends. Lectures are very boring and extremely difficult to follow and I don't have much time in my schedule to get extra help. You will rely on your peers and the textbook to learn in his class. The tests are very difficult.
A very boooooooring prof who cares nothing less for the students even though they're sleeping. Best to rely on the textbook instead. It could be very helpful.
wears the variations of the samething everyday

He's a good prof, he wants his students to understand the concepts behind the math, and you can tell he really likes math too. He tries to tell jokes in class too. Probably my favorite math prof so far.

Excellent professor! Had him as my calculus 1 professor and you could tell that he was passionate not only about the subjects that he taught, but also had put in the time and effort to rehearse the subject matter that he wanted to deliver in front of his students. Made learning differential calculus a lot more fun than it would have been otherwise!

Calculus 1 is difficult and yet it was one of my favourite courses because of Dr. J. I have rarely met someone who is so committed and caring about his students' learning. He is one of the kindest and most approachable professors and so encouraging. But don't expect to breeze through just because Dr. J is nice; work hard and do all of the homework.

One of the best professors I've ever come across. His lectures are both informative and funny. He really encourages asking questions and is always so happy when someone asks a question. Great office hours, again, he is actually happy that you are trying to learn. You can tell he loves what he does . 100% would take a course with him again.

Very engaging lecture, very open to questions. Hands down one of my favorite professors thus far. He always talks to the students in the first couple of rows before class. If you feel like you would need help sit up front and ask him stuff.
Final was satanically hard, beyond anything in the class. His sloppy handwriting and sloppy words are maddening. He is better than most math teachers, though.
By definition Veselin Jungic is the number one professor. Best professor I have had so far at SFU. "This is a good news."
Dr. J is awesome. His lectures are really interesting, and he's a very dedicated teacher.
Best prof ever. Very passionate about what he teaches. Approachable, willing to help. Replied my email within 5 minutes.

Great prof... Especially for the early classes. He always has energy and gets your interest in the class and material he is teaching. During the semester i took this course, It was the only course where i did not skip a single class of even though it was at 8:30 AM... It was by far my favorite class. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS PROF!!!
Just Take It. You'll love it
DEFINATELY RECOMMEND!!!  He is very passionate about the subject, energetic at 8:30 in the morning and very willing to help.

Very funny prof, passionate about mathematics and tries to influence his students as well to take the same interest. EXTREMELY energetic esp. at 830am! Gives sample midterms that are fairly similar to the real ones, so no surprises really. No laptop in lecture unless you're at the back--he doesn't like how it distracts others. BY DEFINITION! haha

very passionate about math, somewhat organized schedule, online assignment are somewhat tricky and paper assignment somewhat trickier. MT were FAIR, practice MT and MT were VERY similar and lets u know in advance what to study.  HATES laptops, don't let him see u with a laptop in his lecture.  Definitely Recommended

he kept me awake for every single lecture at 8:30 am for 2 semesters! i didn't think it was possible. I got a B in 151 and an A- in 152, he is an awesome and the open labs are SUCH a big help. His practice exams are VERY similar to the actual ones. *two thumbs up*

I LOVE this man, he is soo funny,,and the notes are extremly helpfull if you understand the lec it'll very easy for u to catch up,, his exame are fair and it's like the sample ,so make sure that u understand the sample-exame very well!!
Awesome teacher, his jokes are stupid...seriously...

A great man. Very passionate about his subject, and cares about his students. Won SFU Excellence in Teaching Award in 2007 and he deserves it! Bumped me up from a D to a C- so I could progress to MATH 152 without having to retake 151. Will allow final to be worth 80% if you did poorly on midterms. Make sure you understand his practice exams!

He is an awesome prof. All his notes and lectures are coordinated very well. He is great help when you ask him questions and he definitely knows his stuff well. Make sure you do the assigned questions!
memorise practice exams
Oh wow, an enthusiastic, helpful math professor. This guy is amazing.

he's a great prof. notes relate exactly to assignments and exams. tries to make calculus interesting (sounds impossible but he can help). Make sure to keep with the material and you will do just fine. I had 151 and 152 with him, 152 was def. much harder but i ended up with an A-, only because of his teaching ways!

best calculus prof I've had so far, funny too! with his "what is the same as" and his love for math (math girl). He has his own lecture notes and goes over examples of questions and how to do them during the lecture. GOOD notes. make sure you go to lectures and take those notes. never bored in class :)

Never got anything from his lectures... But overall not a bad guy.  Except that he offered bonus marks to the highest graded students if they gave him worked solutions to sample final problems.  Not exactly high on ethics.

friendly prof. has printout notes that you go over and fill in during lectures. midterm Qs are given on midterm review lec printouts. fill them in during lecture and you'll do fine. final is heavy on definitions.
he's a very nice person and he knows his stuff. Midterm is ok but final is way too hard. You need to work very hard to get a decent mark if you have never taken calculus before

He is a great professor and his midterms are very similar to his real midterms but the final was tough!  His sample final was similar to his final, but there were some q's which were just a lot harder than his midterm q's.  No calculators are allowed, so its harder to study when most q's in the book require a calculator.
Hilarious prof. Good structure to his lecture notes. Midterms and Exams are the same as sample midterms. Really passionate and caring. He loves what he's teaching and it really shows.
Not a bad prof. His midterms and finals are same as the samples. =]. but his english is sometimes funny.

An amazing prof! He actually reads people's online comments and helps. He's exams are just like the practice exams he gives. He's very funny and very passionate. He answers questions and the TA's are really helpful. This class requires work but the hard work definitely pay off. One of my favourite profs! Only annoyance is the "WHICH is the same as"

He makes the notes very simple and easy to understand. His exam questions are just a little bit harder, very fair exams though. He has a bit of accent but it's understandable and he is very willing to help.

not a prof for you if you havent taken calculus before. he expects you to come in with so much knowledge, rather than teaching it too you. dont take this class with no experience. it will be a waste of your time and money
